nodes.bodyText:
are you sure about threshold?
definition in https://github.com/AdoptOpenJDK/openjdk-jdk11/blob/master/src/jdk.jfr/share/conf/jfr/default.jfc#L426 shows only cutoff
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -152,9 +152,9 @@ jdk.TenuringDistribution#enabled=true
 jdk.G1HeapRegionInformation#enabled=false
 jdk.G1HeapRegionInformation#period=everyChunk
 jdk.G1HeapRegionTypeChange#enabled=false
-jdk.OldObjectSample#enabled=false
+jdk.OldObjectSample#enabled=true
 jdk.OldObjectSample#stackTrace=true
-jdk.OldObjectSample#cutoff=900 ms
+jdk.OldObjectSample#threshold=0 ms

nodes.bodyText: I've only ever used cutoff for controlling the time available for chasing references.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -152,9 +152,9 @@ jdk.TenuringDistribution#enabled=true
